headline: Trump backs GOP’s J.D. Vance in U.S. Senate primary in Ohio
author: Jim Provance
sentences:
“Ohio voters want someone who has fought and delivered for the America First movement — and won’t support an elitist who insulted their intelligence and then pretended to be MAGA when it suited his political ambitions.”
Mr. Ryan called Mr. Vance a “multi-millionaire elitist.”
“...Tim Ryan has spent his entire life fighting for the working people whom J.D.

“If Donald Trump's anointment and Big Tech billionaire Peter Thiel’s millions are enough to drag Silicon Valley Vance out of the primary he's currently losing, we welcome this match-up.”
The endorsement will serve as a test of Mr. Trump's ability to continue to sway Republican voters, particularly in a state he won twice by 8 percentage points.

“While I was traveling over 150,000 miles across Ohio doing that important work for the America First agenda, JD Vance was in Silicon Valley and cable news studios trashing President Trump, calling him an ‘idiot,’ ‘noxious,’ and publicly considering voting for Hillary Clinton to stop Trump.

“The Democrats will be spending many millions of dollars, but the good news is that they have a defective candidate who ran for President and garnered exactly zero percent in the polls,” he said in reference to Youngstown area U.S. Rep. Tim Ryan, a Democratic presidential candidate in 2020.

He said Mr. Vance is strong on the Mexican border, crime, taxes, and China tariffs and would be a “warrior on the rigged and stolen presidential election.”
Some of the other candidates and Ohio Republicans had been scrambling in recent days in hopes of heading off a Vance endorsement.

“An early endorsement for an established Trump candidate may have had a positive effect,” state Rep. Gary Click (R., Vickery), a Trump supporter, said Friday in an opinion piece that he had meant to be used to discourage the former president's move.

As of Friday, an averaging of polls by Real Clear Politics had Mr. Vance running third at 14 percent among Republicans, behind former Ohio Treasurer Josh Mandel at 21 percent and Cleveland investment banker Mike Gibbons at 19.3 percent.

Mr. Vance is now highly complimentary of Mr. Trump, calling him “the best president of my lifetime.”
“...he never bent to the mob and fought consistently for hardworking Americans,” he said.

I’m honored and thrilled to have his support.”
Mr. Trump said the decision was not easy, given his ties to some of the other candidates and the former campaign allies that they’ve hired.
The endorsement had been hungrily sought by others in the race who had tried to remind the former president in recent days of the prior comments Mr. Vance had made about him.
“However, a late endorsement, after voters have already been hitting the polls, will tarnish the Trump brand and even more so if the endorsement is for Vance,” he said.
“While I would have loved the endorsement, I continue to be in a strong position in this race because I have been an America First champion and fighter,” he said.
Vance may have said some not so great things about me in the past, but he gets it now, and I have seen that in spades,” Mr. Trump said in a statement.
